name: INPC
title: Intl Neuroblastoma Path Prog Class (INPC)
subtitle: Shimada Classification, Unfavorable histology or Favorable histology
notes:
**Note 1:** This SSDI is effective for diagnosis years 2024+
* For cases diagnosed 2018-2023, leave this SSDI blank

**Note 2:** The International Neuroblastoma Pathology Prognostic Classification (INPC) categorizes neuroblastomas as favorable or unfavorable histologies based on the following factors: age, neuroblastic maturation, Schwannian stromal content, Mitosis-kayorrhexis index (MKI), and degree of differentiation (grade). 
* Primary sources of information: pathology report, CAP Protocol


**Note 3:** Physician statement of unfavorable vs favorable histology can be used to code this data item when no other information is available. 

**Note 4:** The International Neuroblastoma Pathology Prognostic Classification (INPC) (unfavorable versus favorable histology) is a biologically relevant classification based on morphologic features of neuroblastic tumors which has prognostic indications. It is based on the following criteria.
* Age
* Neuroblastic maturation
* Schwannian stromal content
* Mitosis-kayorrhexis index (MKI)
* Degree of differentiation (grade)
